unstructured.description: Patients must have histologically or cytologically confirmed locally advanced unresectable or metastatic solid tumor and have failed all available standard of care (SoC) therapy and for whom no curative therapy is available or who are not eligible, intolerant to or refuse standard therapy.
For the dose expansion phase: Patients with locally advanced unresectable or metastatic, non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) and soft tissue sarcoma (STS)
Have an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1.
Life expectancy of at least three months.
Patients must not have clinically significant cardiac disease.
Patients must not have known non-controlled CNS metastasis.
Patients must not have a history of ≥ Grade 3 allergic reactions to mAb therapy as wellas known or suspected allergy or intolerance to any agent given during this study.
Patients must not have had major surgery within 4 weeks before first BA3021 administration.
Patients must not have had prior therapy with a conjugated or unconjugated auristatin derivative/vinca-binding site targeting payload.
Patients must not have known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection, active hepatitis B and/or hepatitis C.
Patients must not be women who are pregnant or breast feeding.

detail_description:
This is a multi-center, open-label, Phase 1/2 study designed to evaluate the safety,
      tolerability, PK, immunogenicity, and antitumor activity of BA3021, a conditionally active
      biologic (CAB) ROR2-targeted antibody drug conjugate (CAB-ROR2-ADC) BA3021 in patients with
      advanced solid tumors.

      This study will consist of a dose escalation phase and a dose expansion phase with BA3021 in
      Phase 1. Phase 2 will study BA3021 alone or in combination with a PD-1 inhibitor.
official_title: A Phase 1/2 Safety and Efficacy Dose Escalation / Dose Expansion Study of a CAB-ROR2-ADC, Alone and in Combination With a PD-1 Inhibitor, in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors (Ph1) and Melanoma and NSCLC Patients (Ph2)

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1 and 2: Best overall response (OR)
outcome_measures.description: All post-baseline disease assessments that occur prior to the initiation of subsequent anticancer therapy

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1 and 2: Disease control rate (DCR)
outcome_measures.description: Proportion of patients with a best overall response of confirmed CR, confirmed PR, or stable disease (SD) ≥ 12 weeks

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1 and 2: Duration of response (DOR)
outcome_measures.description: Time from the first documented OR until the first documented disease progression or death (due to any cause), whichever occurs first

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1 and 2: Overall survival (OS)
outcome_measures.description: Time from the first dose of BA3021 treatment until death due to any cause

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1 and 2: Progression-free survival (PFS)
outcome_measures.description: Time from the first dose of IP until the first documentation of disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1 and 2: Safety Profile
outcome_measures.description: Frequency and severity of AEs and/or SAEs

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1 and 2: Time to response (TTR)
outcome_measures.description: Time from the first dose of investigational product until the first documentation of OR

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1 and 2: Tumor size
outcome_measures.description: Percent change from baseline in tumor size

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1: Confirmed Objective Response Rate (ORR)
outcome_measures.description: Proportion of patients who achieve a confirmed CR or PR

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1: Immunogenicity
outcome_measures.description: The number and percentage of patients who develop detectable anti-drug antibodies (ADAs)

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1: Pharmacokinetics
outcome_measures.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1: Pharmacokinetics
outcome_measures.description: Plasma concentrations of ADC, total antibody and MMAE

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1: Safety Profile
outcome_measures.description: Assess dose limiting toxicity as defined in the protocol

outcome_measures.name: Phase 1: Safety Profile
outcome_measures.description: Assess maximum tolerated dose as defined in the protocol

outcome_measures.name: Phase 2: Confirmed Objective Response Rate (ORR)
outcome_measures.description: Proportion of patients who achieve a confirmed CR or PR

brief_summary: The objective of this study is to assess safety and efficacy of CAB-ROR2-ADC in solid tumors
brief_title: CAB-ROR2-ADC Safety and Efficacy Study in Patients With TNBC or Head & Neck Cancer (Ph1) and NSCLC or Melanoma (Ph2)
